title: Nuclear C*-algebra
summary: In the mathematical field of functional analysis, a nuclear C*-algebra is a C*-algebra A {\displaystyle A} such that for every C*-algebra B {\displaystyle B} the injective and projective C*-cross norms coincides on the algebraic tensor product A ⊗ B {\displaystyle A\otimes B} and the completion of A ⊗ B {\displaystyle A\otimes B} with respect to this norm is a C*-algebra. This property was first studied by Takesaki (1964) under the name "Property T", which is not related to Kazhdan's property T.
